content.description: Let f be a function that has derivatives of all orders for all real numbers. Assume f (1)=3, f ′ (1) =−2, f ″(1)= 2 and f ‴ (1)=4
content.question: Write the second-degree Taylor polynomial for f', the derivative of f, aboutx=1 and use it to approximate f′(1.2) .

frqParts.text: Write the second-degree Taylor polynomial for f', the derivative of f, aboutx=1 and use it to approximate f′(1.2) .

topic.text: 10.15: (BC ONLY) Representing Functions as Power Series

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
